channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA

item.title: Report E-2024050639
item.description:
Report E-2024050639

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-10
  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 1/2-gallon of F73XX Production Bake Enamel with PHX Colorants GREY RAL 7035 was released from one 1-gallon plastic can, impacting 2 boxes each containing 3 containers of the same product and the trailer floor, likely due to not being strapped in properly prior to arrival. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will clean the spill with absorbent and place the contents into a 30-gallon poly drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050500
item.description:
Report E-2024050500

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-24T15:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-22
  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee noticed a small stain on the concrete underneath an outbound trailer that was parked at Veolia's ten day intransit facility in Port Allen, LA. The trailer was then unloaded to find the source of the stain. A drum was discovered to have a small pinhole leak near the top of the drum where approximately 1 gallon of liquid was released. The spill was cleaned using oil dry and the drum was overpacked.

item.title: Report E-2024050495
item.description:
Report E-2024050495

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-24T15:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-19
  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee arrived at Veolia's ten day intransit facility to prepare for travel to another office for the week when they noticed a large spill in the warehouse. The employee determined that the spill was from one 55-1A2 open top metal drum containing "UN1325, Waste Flammable Solids, Organic, n.o.s. (Petroleum Hydrocarbons), 4.1, III, RQ (D001)." The leak was traced to a pinhole puncture in the drum. The poor integrity of the container previously went unnoticed because the puncture did not puncture the exterior paint; a blister had formed and kept the liquid from spilling until the blister ruptured. Approximately 5 gallons of liquid was released until the leak stopped on its own over the weekend and was discovered the following morning. While the employee moved the drum to be overpacked and was taking pictures of the incident, the drum began to leak again from the same blister. The employee overpacked the drum, put down oil dry to clean the spill, made sure no other drums were also leaking, and contacted management to inform them of the incident.
